docs.lead_paragraph: New U.S. dietary guidelines on Thursday urged Americans to cut their sugar and saturated fat intake to less than 10 percent of daily calories, but consumer advocates said the curbs did not provide clear guidance on the need to lower consumption of meat.

headline.main: U.S. Cracks Down on Americans' Intake of Sugar, Saturated Fat
headline.print_headline: U.S. Cracks Down on Americans' Intake of Sugar, Saturated Fat

headline.main: New Dietary Guidelines Urge Less Sugar for All and Less Protein for Boys and Men
headline.print_headline: New Dietary Guidelines Urge Sharp Cuts in Sugar

docs.abstract: New federal dietary guidelines announced on Thursday urge Americans to drastically cut back on sugar, and for the first time have singled out teenage boys and men for eating too much meat.
docs.snippet: New federal dietary guidelines announced on Thursday urge Americans to drastically cut back on sugar, and for the first time have singled out teenage boys and men for eating too much meat.

docs.lead_paragraph: The recent arrests in Utah of three people accused of stealing thousands of dollars' worth of baby formula is the latest example of a problem that officials say is vexing stores and police nationwide as thieves systematically swipe the mixture from shelves and resell it to unsuspecting parents.

headline.main: Big-Dollar Baby Formula Thefts Dog Stores, Police Across US

docs.lead_paragraph: When devastating losses became too much for Harry Solomon, 70, to bear, his mother’s doctor offered some advice: Get a golden retriever.

headline.main: Battling His Depression, a Caregiver Enlists a Companion
headline.print_headline: Battling His Depression, a Caregiver Enlists a Companion

docs.abstract: Metropolitan Council, beneficiary agency of UJA-Federation of New York, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Harry Solomon of Brooklyn pay his rent.
docs.snippet: When devastating losses became too much for Harry Solomon, 70, to bear, his mother’s doctor offered some advice: Get a golden retriever.

headline.main: Mexican Soda Tax Followed by Drop in Sugary Drink Sales

docs.abstract: A tax on sugary drinks in Mexico appears to have had a significant impact: After one year, a new study found, sales of sugary beverages in Mexico fell while bottled water purchases rose.
docs.snippet: A tax on sugary drinks in Mexico appears to have had a significant impact: After one year, a new study found, sales of sugary beverages in Mexico fell while bottled water purchases rose.

docs.abstract: People can work with a diabetes educator to develop an eating plan that includes their favorite foods, albeit in limited amounts.
docs.snippet: People can work with a diabetes educator to develop an eating plan that includes their favorite foods, albeit in limited amounts.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the athletes Charles Sly mentioned to an undercover reporter before taking it all back were clients of the trainer Jason Riley, and that is where the story becomes intriguing.

headline.main: Finding a Common Thread in the Al Jazeera Doping Report

docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of the Times column questions credibility of Charles Sly, who recently recanted statements he made to undercover Al Jazeera journalist detailing alleged doping regimens of handful of high-profile professional athletes.
docs.snippet: Many of the athletes Charles Sly mentioned to an undercover reporter before taking it all back were clients of the trainer Jason Riley, and that is where the story becomes intriguing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pro-government fighters recently evacuated from two besieged villages in northern Syria described harsh conditions there with scarce food and medicine, saying some residents are eating grass to survive and undergoing surgery without anesthesia.

headline.main: Besieged Syrian Villages Run Short of Food, Medicine
headline.print_headline: Besieged Syrian Villages Run Short of Food, Medicine

docs.snippet: Pro-government fighters recently evacuated from two besieged villages in northern Syria described harsh conditions there with scarce food and medicine, saying some residents are eating grass to survive and undergoing surgery without anesthesia.

docs.lead_paragraph: A private autopsy is planned at hospital expense to determine how a 20-year-old college freshman died while on life-support in the midst of a Nevada end-of-life court battle, the family's lawyer and medical center officials said Tuesday.

headline.main: Family, Hospital Team Up on Autopsy in Reno End-Of-Life Case
headline.print_headline: Family, Hospital Team Up on Autopsy in Reno End-Of-Life Case
